types.name: User
types.description: Querying for a person who uses our app

args.name: text
args.description: Part of the id or displayName of a tag

args.name: suggester
args.description: The suggester you want to use. (ID, DISPLAYNAME)

args.name: size
args.description: Specifies the maximum number of suggestions to include in the response.

fields.name: searchResult
fields.description: Retrieve search results by id (Stable)

args.name: id
args.description: Search result id (DynamoDB search bucket unique id)

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: SuggestType
types.description: Retrieve total number of results found and a list of current returned items

args.name: size
args.description: Number of items to retrieve (DynamoDB limit is 100)

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the search results

fields.name: isSealed
fields.description: Whether the result is sealed (better description needed!)

fields.name: searchTerms
fields.description: Requested searchTerms

fields.name: bucketCount
fields.description: Current amount of items in the search bucket

types.name: SearchTermOptionType
types.description: Enum Options for "type" field in searchTermType (Stable)

types.name: SearchResultItem
types.description: Possible Search Result Items (Unstable - more item types may be added)

types.name: Images
types.description: An object with "large" and "small" keys for different sized images

fields.name: primary
fields.description: Main image to show for the hotel
fields.deprecationReason: Field is not used - always returns null!

fields.name: outbound
fields.description: Outbound flight details. Single item in the list means there is a direct flight. Multiple items in the list if there are stopovers.

fields.name: inbound
fields.description: Inbound flight details. Single item in the list means there is a direct flight. Multiple items in the list if there are stopovers.

fields.name: context
fields.description: JSON string with provider specific information - can be retrieved afterwards by the provider after deep linking

fields.name: deepLink
fields.description: Link to the package on Spies.dk

types.name: amenityType
types.description: Data on all the amentities and whether or not they are present

fields.name: id
fields.description: The id of the article tile in the sytem.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the article.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The url of the original article.

fields.name: image
fields.description: The url to the image of the section.

fields.name: text
fields.description: The paragraph text of this section.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The section title.

fields.name: label
fields.description: Readable tag text.

fields.name: value
fields.description: Id of the tag in the taggable system.

args.name: searchString
args.description: All or part of the id or displayName of a tag

args.name: queryType
args.description: The query you want to perform. (QUERY_ID, QUERY_DISPLAYNAME)

args.name: tagType
args.description: The tag type you are searching for. (AMENITY, MARKETING, HOTEL, TILE, GEO)

args.name: start
args.description: Specifies the offset of the first search hit you want to return. Note that the result set is zero-based; the first result is at index 0.

args.name: size
args.description: Specifies the maximum number of search hits to include in the response.

args.name: suggester
args.description: The suggester you want to use. (ID, DISPLAYNAME)

args.name: size
args.description: Specifies the maximum number of suggestions to include in the response.

types.name: SearchTagType
types.description: Retrieve total number of results found and a list of current returned items

types.name: LocationType
types.description: Lat Lon of the tag (optional so no need to specify for tile tags)

types.name: UserMutation
types.description: Mutations for a person who uses our app

args.name: query
args.description: A given set of search-terms, used to execute the blended search

fields.name: id
fields.description: Result id

types.name: TagMutation
types.description: Mutation to create, update or delete a tag

fields.name: tagData
fields.description: The full document for the tag is required as an input and the full document is returned

types.name: LocationInputType
types.description: Lat Lon of the tag (optional so no need to specify for tile tags)

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL’s execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.
